# Demo 1 - Simple Pie Chart

This page demonstrates a simple pie chart using GDS-compliant colours and fonts.

```{python}
#| echo: false
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

labels = ['Craig Actually Coded', "Craig Should've Coded"]
sizes = [1, 99]
# GDS-compliant blue and grey
colors = ['#1d70b8', '#b1b4b6']

plt.rcParams['font.family'] = 'Arial'  # Closest widely available font to GDS Transport

fig, ax = plt.subplots()
ax.pie(
    sizes, 
    labels=labels, 
    colors=colors, 
    autopct='%1.1f%%', 
    startangle=90,
    textprops={'fontsize': 12, 'color': '#0b0c0c', 'fontfamily': 'Arial'}  # GDS black for text
)
ax.axis('equal')
plt.title("Craig's Coding in 20 Years", fontsize=16, color='#1d70b8', fontfamily='Arial')  # GDS blue for title
fig
```
